TopicTitle: Hello! I'm new, but been playing for months

Articles.Content:
Hi, I'm Ankoopa and I've been playing KSP since March 30, 2014, the date when I bought it from Steam. My interest in space flight simulators made me buy the game.

Even though I've been playing the game for months, I've only got the hang of getting into orbit, Landing on the Mun and Minmus then back to Kerbin and a bit of landing on Eve and Duna via on a one-way trip. Currently, I'm still trying to learn how to rendezvous, docking and two-way interplanetary travels.

If only I could find some tutorials about it...

Hi Ankoopa. That is not bad progress. Welcome to the forum.

Edited November 5, 2014 by Vanamonde
WooWee!!! Welcome to the forums, enjoy your stay! We have snacks in the corner.
Specialist290 maintains an excellent catalogue of all the main tutorials in The Drawing Board - appropriately enough in the tutorials section of these forums.

Thanks for the greetings guys! I feel welcomed in the KSP community.

And also, thanks for the library of tutorials!

And also, thanks for the library of tutorials!

No problem. Hope you find it helpful!

(Also, welcome to the forums!)
Das, a twitch streamer, also does pretty good tutorials. He has a stream Friday at 8pm, which will likely be of help.
Scott manly on YouTube has some really good tutorials, most of them are out of date, but still relevant.
